name: minikube
description: minikube provisions and manages local Kubernetes clusters optimized for development workflows.

inheritedOptions.description: If true, adds the file directory to the header of the log messages
log to standard error as well as files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
The name of the cluster bootstrapper that will set up the Kubernetes cluster.
--log_backtrace_at=:0: when logging hits line file:N, emit a stack trace
If non-empty, write log files in this directory (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
If non-empty, use this log file (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
Defines the maximum size a log file can grow to (no effect when -logtostderr=true). Unit is megabytes. If the value is 0, the maximum file size is unlimited.
log to standard error instead of files
If true, only write logs to their native severity level (vs also writing to each lower severity level; no effect when -logtostderr=true)
The name of the minikube VM being used. This can be set to allow having multiple instances of minikube independently.
Force to use rootless driver (docker and podman driver only)
Skip recording the current command in the audit logs.
If true, avoid header prefixes in the log messages
If true, avoid headers when opening log files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
logs at or above this threshold go to stderr when writing to files and stderr (no effect when -logtostderr=true or -alsologtostderr=false)
Specifies the user executing the operation. Useful for auditing operations executed by 3rd party tools. Defaults to the operating system username.
number for the log level verbosity
comma-separated list of pattern=N settings for file-filtered logging

subcommands.name: start
subcommands.description: Starts a local Kubernetes cluster

options.description: Enable addons. see `minikube addons list` for a list of valid addon names.
A set of apiserver IP Addresses which are used in the generated certificate for kubernetes. This can be used if you want to make the apiserver available from outside the machine
The authoritative apiserver hostname for apiserver certificates and connectivity. This can be used if you want to make the apiserver available from outside the machine
A set of apiserver names which are used in the generated certificate for kubernetes. This can be used if you want to make the apiserver available from outside the machine
The apiserver listening port
If set, automatically updates drivers to the latest version. Defaults to true.
The base image to use for docker/podman drivers. Intended for local development.
Location to fetch kubectl, kubelet, & kubeadm binaries from.
If true, cache docker images for the current bootstrapper and load them into the machine. Always false with --driver=none.
Duration until minikube certificate expiration, defaults to three years (26280h).
CNI plug-in to use. Valid options: auto, bridge, calico, cilium, flannel, kindnet, or path to a CNI manifest (default: auto)
The container runtime to be used. Valid options: docker, cri-o, containerd (default: auto)
Number of CPUs allocated to Kubernetes. Use "max" to use the maximum number of CPUs.
The cri socket path to be used.
If set, delete the current cluster if start fails and try again. Defaults to false.
Disables the filesystem mounts provided by the hypervisors
If set, disables metrics reporting (CPU and memory usage), this can improve CPU usage. Defaults to false.
If set, disables optimizations that are set for local Kubernetes. Including decreasing CoreDNS replicas from 2 to 1. Defaults to false.
Disk size allocated to the minikube VM (format: <number>[<unit>], where unit = b, k, m or g).
The cluster dns domain name used in the Kubernetes cluster
Enable proxy for NAT DNS requests (virtualbox driver only)
Environment variables to pass to the Docker daemon. (format: key=value)
Specify arbitrary flags to pass to the Docker daemon. (format: key=value)
If true, only download and cache files for later use - don't install or start anything.
Driver is one of: virtualbox, kvm2, qemu2, qemu, vmware, none, docker, podman, ssh (defaults to auto-detect)
dry-run mode. Validates configuration, but does not mutate system state
if true, will embed the certs in kubeconfig.
DEPRECATED: Replaced by --cni=bridge

A set of key=value pairs that describe configuration that may be passed to different components. The key should be '.' separated, and the first part before the dot is the component to apply the configuration to. Valid components are: kubelet, kubeadm, apiserver, controller-manager, etcd, proxy, scheduler Valid kubeadm parameters: ignore-preflight-errors, dry-run, kubeconfig, kubeconfig-dir, node-name, cri-socket, experimental-upload-certs, certificate-key, rootfs, skip-phases, pod-network-cidr
Number of extra disks created and attached to the minikube VM (currently only implemented for hyperkit, kvm2, and qemu2 drivers)
A set of key=value pairs that describe feature gates for alpha/experimental features.
Force minikube to perform possibly dangerous operations
If set, force the container runtime to use systemd as cgroup manager. Defaults to false.
Enable host resolver for NAT DNS requests (virtualbox driver only)
The CIDR to be used for the minikube VM (virtualbox driver only)
NIC Type used for host only network. One of Am79C970A, Am79C973, 82540EM, 82543GC, 82545EM, or virtio (virtualbox driver only)
Location of the VPNKit socket used for networking. If empty, disables Hyperkit VPNKitSock, if 'auto' uses Docker for Mac VPNKit connection, otherwise uses the specified VSock (hyperkit driver only)
List of guest VSock ports that should be exposed as sockets on the host (hyperkit driver only)
External Adapter on which external switch will be created if no external switch is found. (hyperv driver only)
Whether to use external switch over Default Switch if virtual switch not explicitly specified. (hyperv driver only)
The hyperv virtual switch name. Defaults to first found. (hyperv driver only)
Country code of the image mirror to be used. Leave empty to use the global one. For Chinese mainland users, set it to cn.

Alternative image repository to pull docker images from. This can be used when you have limited access to gcr.io. Set it to "auto" to let minikube decide one for you. For Chinese mainland users, you may use local gcr.io mirrors such as registry.cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/google_containers
Insecure Docker registries to pass to the Docker daemon. The default service CIDR range will automatically be added.
If set, install addons. Defaults to true.
Allow user prompts for more information
Locations to fetch the minikube ISO from.
This will keep the existing kubectl context and will create a minikube context.
The Kubernetes version that the minikube VM will use (ex: v1.2.3, 'stable' for v1.27.3, 'latest' for v1.27.3). Defaults to 'stable'.
Enable experimental NVIDIA GPU support in minikube
Hide the hypervisor signature from the guest in minikube (kvm2 driver only)
The KVM default network name. (kvm2 driver only)
Simulate numa node count in minikube, supported numa node count range is 1-8 (kvm2 driver only)
The KVM QEMU connection URI. (kvm2 driver only)
IP Address to use to expose ports (docker and podman driver only)
Amount of RAM to allocate to Kubernetes (format: <number>[<unit>], where unit = b, k, m or g). Use "max" to use the maximum amount of memory.
This will start the mount daemon and automatically mount files into minikube.
Specify the 9p version that the mount should use
Default group id used for the mount
Specify the ip that the mount should be setup on
The number of bytes to use for 9p packet payload
Additional mount options, such as cache=fscache
Specify the port that the mount should be setup on, where 0 means any free port.
The argument to pass the minikube mount command on start.
Specify the mount filesystem type (supported types: 9p)
Default user id used for the mount
The named space to activate after start
NIC Type used for nat network. One of Am79C970A, Am79C973, 82540EM, 82543GC, 82545EM, or virtio (virtualbox driver only)

Use native Golang SSH client (default true). Set to 'false' to use the command line 'ssh' command when accessing the docker machine. Useful for the machine drivers when they will not start with 'Waiting for SSH'.
network to run minikube with. Now it is used by docker/podman and KVM drivers. If left empty, minikube will create a new network.
DEPRECATED: Replaced by --cni
Local folders to share with Guest via NFS mounts (hyperkit driver only)
Where to root the NFS Shares, defaults to /nfsshares (hyperkit driver only)
If set, minikube VM/container will start without starting or configuring Kubernetes. (only works on new clusters)
Disable checking for the availability of hardware virtualization before the vm is started (virtualbox driver only)
The number of nodes to spin up. Defaults to 1.
Format to print stdout in. Options include: [text,json]
List of ports that should be exposed (docker and podman driver only)
If set, download tarball of preloaded images if available to improve start time. Defaults to true.
Path to the qemu firmware file. Defaults: For Linux, the default firmware location. For macOS, the brew installation location. For Windows, C:\Program Files\qemu\share
Registry mirrors to pass to the Docker daemon
The CIDR to be used for service cluster IPs.
Path to the socket vmnet client binary (QEMU driver only)
Path to socket vmnet binary (QEMU driver only)
IP address (ssh driver only)
SSH key (ssh driver only)
SSH port (ssh driver only)
SSH user (ssh driver only)
Set a static IP for the minikube cluster, the IP must be: private, IPv4, and the last octet must be between 2 and 254, for example 192.168.200.200 (Docker and Podman drivers only)
Subnet to be used on kic cluster. If left empty, minikube will choose subnet address, beginning from 192.168.49.0. (docker and podman driver only)
Send trace events. Options include: [gcp]
Provide VM UUID to restore MAC address (hyperkit driver only)
Filter to use only VM Drivers
DEPRECATED, use `driver` instead.

comma separated list of Kubernetes components to verify and wait for after starting a cluster. defaults to "apiserver,system_pods", available options: "apiserver,system_pods,default_sa,apps_running,node_ready,kubelet" . other acceptable values are 'all' or 'none', 'true' and 'false'
max time to wait per Kubernetes or host to be healthy.

subcommands.name: status
subcommands.description: Gets the status of a local Kubernetes cluster

options.description: type: Control Plane host: {{.Host}} kubelet: {{.Kubelet}} apiserver: {{.APIServer}} kubeconfig: {{.Kubeconfig}} {{- if .TimeToStop }} timeToStop: {{.TimeToStop}} {{- end }} {{- if .DockerEnv }} docker-env: {{.DockerEnv}} {{- end }} {{- if .PodManEnv }} podman-env: {{.PodManEnv}} {{- end }} ': Go template format string for the status output. The format for Go templates can be found here: https://pkg.go.dev/text/template For the list accessible variables for the template, see the struct values here: https://pkg.go.dev/k8s.io/minikube/cmd/minikube/cmd#Status
output layout (EXPERIMENTAL, JSON only): 'nodes' or 'cluster'
The node to check status for. Defaults to control plane. Leave blank with default format for status on all nodes.
minikube status --output OUTPUT. json, text
Continuously listing/getting the status with optional interval duration.

subcommands.name: stop
subcommands.description: Stops a running local Kubernetes cluster

options.description: Set flag to stop all profiles (clusters)
cancel any existing scheduled stop requests
keep the kube-context active after cluster is stopped. Defaults to false.
Format to print stdout in. Options include: [text,json]
Set flag to stop cluster after a set amount of time (e.g. --schedule=5m)

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.description: Deletes a local Kubernetes cluster

options.description: Set flag to delete all profiles
Format to print stdout in. Options include: [text,json]
Set this flag to delete the '.minikube' folder from your user directory.

subcommands.name: unpause
subcommands.description: unpause Kubernetes

options.description: If set, unpause all namespaces
namespaces to unpause
Format to print stdout in. Options include: [text,json]

options.description: Force environment to be configured for a specified shell: [fish, cmd, powershell, tcsh, bash, zsh], default is auto-detect

subcommands.description: Enable or disable a minikube addon

subcommands.name: configure
subcommands.description: Configures the addon w/ADDON_NAME within minikube (example: minikube addons configure registry-creds). For a list of available addons use: minikube addons list

subcommands.name: disable
subcommands.description: Disables the addon w/ADDON_NAME within minikube (example: minikube addons disable dashboard). For a list of available addons use: minikube addons list

subcommands.name: enable
subcommands.description: Enables the addon w/ADDON_NAME within minikube. For a list of available addons use: minikube addons list

options.description: If true, will perform potentially dangerous operations. Use with discretion.
Images used by this addon. Separated by commas.
If true, pods might get deleted and restarted on addon enable
Registries used by this addon. Separated by commas.

subcommands.name: images
subcommands.description: List image names the addon w/ADDON_NAME used. For a list of available addons use: minikube addons list

subcommands.description: Lists all available minikube addons as well as their current statuses (enabled/disabled)

options.description: If true, print web links to addons' documentation if using --output=list (default).

subcommands.name: open
subcommands.description: Opens the addon w/ADDON_NAME within minikube (example: minikube addons open dashboard). For a list of available addons use: minikube addons list

options.description: Open the addons URL with https instead of http
The time interval for each check that wait performs in seconds
Display the Kubernetes addons URL in the CLI instead of opening it in the default browser
Amount of time to wait for service in seconds

subcommands.description: Run a kubectl binary matching the cluster version

options.description: Use SSH for running kubernetes client on the node

options.description: This flag is currently unsupported.

options.description: If set, delete the current cluster if start fails and try again. Defaults to false.

subcommands.description: Copy the specified file into minikube
subcommands.usage: minikube cp <source node name>:<source file path> <target node name>:<target file absolute path> [flags] [options]

options.description: The node to get ssh-key path. Defaults to the primary control plane.

options.description: Add host key to SSH known_hosts file
The node to ssh into. Defaults to the primary control plane.

subcommands.name: ip
subcommands.description: Retrieves the IP address of the specified node

options.description: The node to get IP. Defaults to the primary control plane.

subcommands.description: Returns logs to debug a local Kubernetes cluster

options.description: Show only the audit logs
If present, writes to the provided file instead of stdout.
Show only the most recent journal entries, and continuously print new entries as they are appended to the journal.

Number of lines back to go within the log

tldr:
> Tool to run Kubernetes locally.
> More information: <https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube>.

- Start the cluster:

`minikube start`

- Get the IP address of the cluster:

`minikube ip`

- Access a service named my_service exposed via a node port and get the URL:

`minikube service {{my_service}} --url`

- Open the Kubernetes dashboard in a browser:

`minikube dashboard`

- Stop the running cluster:

`minikube stop`

- Delete the cluster:

`minikube delete`

- Connect to LoadBalancer services:

`minikube tunnel`
